alert.note: Alert for Central Interior; Chatanika River Valley; Dalton Highway Summits; Delta Junction; Eastern Alaska Range North of Trims Camp; Eielson AFB and Salcha; Fairbanks Metro Area; Fortymile Country; Goldstream Valley and Nenana Hills; Nenana; Northern Denali Borough; South Slopes Of The Central Brooks Range; South Slopes Of The Eastern Brooks Range; Tanana Flats; Two Rivers; Upper Chena River Valley; Upper Koyukuk Valley; Upper Tanana Valley; White Mountains and High Terrain South of the Yukon River; Yukon Flats (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 25 at 6:13AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...2 To 4 Inches Of Snow Across The Interior Through Tuesday... Very light snow is occuring over much of the Eastern Interior, with less than an inch expected today. A band of snow is expected to move over the Eastern Interior tonight and continue into Tuesday with an another 1-3 inches of snow tonight and Tuesday. Most of the Interior can expected a total of 2 and 4 inches of snow by Tuesday. Much colder air is expected to move over the Eastern Interior Tuesday into Wednesday with temperatures fall to 20 to 30 below by Tuesday night. In Fairbanks, about one half inch of snow is expected today, with another inch of snow tonight, then snow tapering off Tuesday morning.
